rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/72.52.96.189|72.52.96.189]] to last revision by Themfromspace ([[WP:HG|HG]])
tweak lead - 50gb dual layer discs have been in common use for quite a while, they certainly are not prototypes
The wavelength was wrong it is suppose to be 405nm opposed to the 400 it was set at.
Information on side panel had incorrect information: Capacity - 1TB to 10PB
/* Player profiles */ Deleted a <ref> to a broken link: http://www.gizmorepublic.com/media/blu-ray-profiles-everything-you-wanted-know-
/* Competition from HD DVD */ reference correction
/* Software standards */ added reference to BD-ROM specification
End of the format war and future prospects - last paragraph, grammatical fix ~~
Fixed spacing error in 'capacity = 25 to 33.5' for BlueRay disk profile.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 337347512 by [[Special:Contributions/72.52.96.189|72.52.96.189]] ([[User talk:72.52.96.189|talk]]) rv spam addition
/* End of the format war and future prospects */ Style cleanup over the last paragraph (was close to copyvio). Added citation needed tag. The statement is probably true, but needs a better source.
/* AACS */ As AACS revokation/circumvention is a cat and mouse game, so is keeping the article up to date to know if all the current AACS keys are currently compromised. This can be left out.

Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/58.68.35.170|58.68.35.170]] to version by 206.131.112.136. False positive? [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|Report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot|ClueBot]]. (750295) (Bot)
/* Origins */ Stylistic cleanup, and citation needed
Reordered the applications to reflect the most common usage first
/* Origins */ Redundant. See hard-coating section for the same wording and reference.
/* BD9/BD5 Blu-ray Disc */ BD9/BD5 -- dead for commercial "pressed" distribution, flaky for home usage.
/* Variants */ Rearranged by relationship to base technology, taking in account chronology and importance.
/* Codecs */ informations about transport stream recording
/* External links */ added direct link to Technical White Papers, because it is difficult to find detailed technical informations from the BDA's home page
